name: Kepler-213
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-213 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-213 is a star with 1.394 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.2 times its radius. It is located 2109.38 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-213 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-213 b

Kepler-213 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.46 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-213.

The mass of Kepler-213 b is 3.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-213 b is 1.62 that of Earth. At 3.09 Earth masses, Kepler-213 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-213 c

Kepler-213 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.82 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-213.

The mass of Kepler-213 c is 7.42 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-213 c is 2.34 that of Earth. At 7.42 Earth masses, Kepler-213 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-213, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
